title: Indianapolis bakery selling epic Deflategate-themed cookies
text:
Posted: 2:57 p.m. Friday, Oct. 16, 2015 Indianapolis bakery selling epic Deflategate-themed cookies By Cox Media Group National Content Desk INDIANAPOLIS — 
An Indianapolis bakery has whipped up a few special batches of treats ahead of this weekend’s Colts-Patriots game, which is being billed as having an epic revenge factor. 
It was during the team’s last matchup, the AFC Championship game in which the Patriots trounced the Colts 45-7 , that the Colts complained about the air in the footballs, kicking off the much-hyped “Deflategate” investigation. The NFL’s months-long investigation led to Brady being suspended, which was eventually overturned, and threatened to tarnish the reputation of the Super Bowl champions. 
>> Read more trending stories 
Taylor’s Bakery , billed as the “oldest bakery in the state of Indiana,” is offering some choice desserts for Colts fans. 
First, there are the Tom Brady “Monster” cookies, with a quite good interpretation of the terrible courtroom sketch of Tom Brady that went viral during the Deflategate investigation. Tom Brady "monster" cookies now available! #ColtsNation pic.twitter.com/nWTUIDf2Bz — Taylor's Bakery (@TaylorsBakery) October 16, 2015 
Then there are the “Broken Cell Phone” cookies, in reference to Brady’s refusal to hand over his phone to NFL investigators, who were seeking information about Brady’s role in football air pressure tampering. — Taylor's Bakery (@TaylorsBakery) October 16, 2015 
Taylor’s Bakery will also offer “Deflate Cakes” for $15. #DeflateCakes will be on sale Friday 10/16/15 for $15. #ColtsNation make sure to get one before the big #Colts game! pic.twitter.com/3fWQsN5fwk
